Title: Prohibits unsolicited telemarketing sales calls during certain declared states of emergency
Summary: Prohibits unsolicited telemarketing sales calls during a declared state of emergency or disaster emergency where the declaration or proclamation of emergency includes a finding that unsolicited telemarketing sales calls would impair actions taken to limit, control, or mitigate the emergency; explains the basis of such finding; provides that such prohibition may not extend for a period of more than two weeks, subject to renewal for additional two-week periods by further findings of necessity made at the end of each two-week period.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to prohibiting unsolicited telemarketing sales calls during certain declared states of emergency
